details.flavorText: Caligni stalkers are often leaders of caligni enclaves.

description.value:
You create a shroud of darkness that prevents light from penetrating or emanating within the area. Light does not enter the area and any non-magical light sources, such as a torch or lantern, do not emanate any light while inside the area, even if their light radius would extend beyond the darkness. This also suppresses magical light of your darkness spell's level or lower. Light can't pass through, so creatures in the area can't see outside. From outside, it appears as a globe of pure darkness.

Heightened Even creatures with darkvision (but not greater darkvision) can barely see through the darkness. They treat targets seen through the darkness as @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Concealed]{Concealed}.

You call forth a cloud of mist. All creatures within the mist become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Concealed]{Concealed}, and all creatures outside the mist become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Concealed]{Concealed} to creatures within it. You can Dismiss the cloud.

You send out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. You receive no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. You can choose to ignore magic you're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of you and your allies.

You detect illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower level than the level of your detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an invisibility potion) typically are detected normally.

Heightened You learn the school of magic for the highest-level effect within range that the spell detects. If multiple effects are equally strong, the GM determines which you learn.
Heightened As 3rd level, but you also pinpoint the source of the highest-level magic. Like for an imprecise sense, you don't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).

When the stalker dies, their body combusts in a flash of white-hot flame. All creatures in a 20-foot burst take [[/r 5d6 # fire damage]] fire damage (basic Reflex save). The stalker's gear and treasure are unaffected by the flames and are left in a pile where they died.

The caligni stalker makes two Strikes against the same target, one with each of their shortswords. The stalker combines the damage of any attacks that hit and applies precision damage, resistances, and weaknesses only once. Both attacks count toward the stalker's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty increases only after both attacks.

as long as the effect itself makes sound.">auditory) Each caligni creeper within 30 feet of the stalker can @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Step]{Step}. Each creeper can benefit from Encircling Command only once per round.

The Caligni Stalker deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Flat-Footed]{Flat-Footed} creatures.
When the monster Strikes a creature that has the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Flat-Footed]{Flat-Footed} condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.
Saving Throw DC 16 Fortitude; <Maximum Duration 6 rounds; Stage 1 1d6 poison and enfeebled 1 (1 round); Stage 2 as stage 1; Stage 3 1d6 poison and enfeebled 2 (1 round)
